ygData.subject: Re: Guild Question
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail- Sounds like you want to be completely out of this guild - just type in /guildremove to regain your honour.  Once you leave the guild you probably be
ygData.messageBody:
Hail-

Sounds like you want to be completely "out" of this guild - just type in
"/guildremove" to regain your honour. Once you leave the guild you probably
be a "Lamr lozer" and "KOS dood", but since the little pricks can't actually
hurt you anyway, I wouldn't get too worried. If they harass you, just get in
touch with your local GM.

You can find all the other guild commands on the everquest website.



-----Original Message-----
From: McConnell, Jeff <Jeff.McConnell@...>
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com' <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, 12 May 1999 20:36
Subject: [eqpaladin] Guild Question


>From: "McConnell, Jeff" <Jeff.McConnell@...>
>
>Hail Fellow Holy Warriors
> I know that this does not really relate to "paladin stuff" but through
>the emails we have
>built a small community here and I have had many game questions answered
>here so this
>seemed like the best place to ask for help. I am currently a lvl 12 (1
>bubble to 13th) High
>Elf Paladin currently operating on the Cazic Thule server on the continent
>of Faydwer and
>I made a horrible mistake. I rushed into joining a guild not knowing what
>type of people
>the guild was and more wanting brotherhood then anything else. To my horror
>I realized I
>had joined a gang of petty kill stealing, cheat exploiting, bug exploiting
>thugs. My problem
>is that the guild officers refuse to allow me to leave the guild and was
>hoping someone
>could tell me a way that I can quit the guild without being removed.
>
>Thank you all and may Tunare bless you all and may your blades find there
>mark
>Sol
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Having difficulty getting "in synch" with list members?
>http://www.onelist.com
>Try ONElist's Shared Calendar to organize events, meetings and more!
>
